website_summaries.verdict: A well-built dial caliper that gives you fast, precise measurements and won't wear out with extended use.
pros: Measures inside, outside, depth, and step
cons: This caliper isn't for you if you need something that can give you a precise measurement in thousandths of an inch

customer_reviews.title: The weight feels good in hand
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of feeding my generic, digital calipers batteries and so the hunt began for an analogue (Dial) caliper. They say a picture is worth a 1000 words and so I will keep this review short and upload lots of photos instead. The weight feels good in hand. Needed no calibration out of the box but recalibration takes 2 seconds. The locking feature is nice for repeat measurements. Dial reads out in 1/16ths of an inch with hash marks every 32nd and 64th in between. Max measurement is 6 1/4". OAL is 9 7/64" collapsed. Very happy with this purchase and I expect it will be a part of my wood shop for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: Pickle Rick

customer_reviews.title: Well crafted in its price class
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality dial caliper, calibrated in handy fractions of an inch. It also gives hundredths. It has good heft and feels sturdy, but naturally wouldn’t take kindly to droppage. The gears mesh well and don’t skip, and it reliably returns to zero. It aligns correctly with a quality ruler. The dial run along the stick could be smoother. This may be a function of lubrication. In any event, it does not appear to affect accuracy. The dial markings are clear and crisp. I really don’t see anything not to like about it. First unit arrived in cracked case, and Amazon replaced it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Liz J

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a practical Caliper.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made insturment that will last for years and years if taken care of. I have finally found a Caliper that is practical for me to use; one that displays in fractions instead of decimals. Is that rivet is a 1/8 or is it a 9/64? This Caliper will give you the answer right on the dial. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnwp

customer_reviews.title: Accurate & Easy!
customer_reviews.text: A really nicely crafted product! The machining is flawless as well as polish & finishing, very accurate as I’ve checked it against my micrometer. Easy to read fractional measurements. I would much rather have the inside dial (.001) be an inch dial, much like hands on a clock 0-6 inches for a faster reading. The storage case is a little cumbersome to open but that’s the only downside.
customer_reviews.author: Dangerous Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for woodworking, etc
customer_reviews.text: Very nice to have for quick use around the shop for woodworking. Nice to be able to read out the fractional sizes for drill bits, screws, etc. I have a battery powered caliper that reads thousands of an inch, along with metric and decimal, but the decimal readout is not so useful due to too much resolution making it unstable to read. Also, batteries have a way of going bad when needed, so it's nice to have one that, though not quite as accurate, is reliable and doesn't keep shutting off.
customer_reviews.author: Marty d'FriedTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I lived this long without this
customer_reviews.text: The fractional nomenclature is great! Overall this tool feels solid and well built. Much heavier than those cheap-o digital calipers I've thrown so many away of. Action feels very smooth and I find I much prefer sneaking up on a size with a dial rather than digits, seems easier to watch.
customer_reviews.author: WCK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Read, Accurate, Smooth
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect this caliper to be nearly as nice as it is. It is nicely made and is easy to read, a quality not always found in other fractional dial calipers. The fit and finish is very good and mine measures accurately when tested with known standards. This is a good caliper at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin La Due/La Due Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Very nice calipers.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for use in woodworking and I absolutely love it. It is very easy to read and seems to be quite accurate. They feel solid and good quality. Feels like something that would cost a lot more than 30 bucks. There is a little wheel at the bottom for slowing opening or closing the caliper jaws and a thumbscrew to lock them in position. The tips of the jaws are very sharp, which is helpful to scribe a mark in wood, rather than using a less accurate pencil mark. I've only had them a few weeks and I've used them at least a dozen times already.
customer_reviews.author: aglowucannotsee

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement
customer_reviews.text: I have several digital calipers in my tool kit. The first couple I bought at HF, and they were quirky. The switched from decimal to metric while I was measuring, or the measurement itself jumped from one number to another for no reason. I decided to spend more money and buy a "good one" From a quality tool company. In time, it started doing the same thing. I've given up on them and purchased this tool as their replacement. No batteries and accurate measurements every time. I love it. I wish I'd bought this one first.
customer_reviews.author: Peter E. Misiaszek

customer_reviews.title: A great tool and excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a replacement for a set of digital calipers. These are perfect for working with fractional measurements. With digital calipers, a reading like 27/64ths is a bit mystifying; with the dial, it's easy to see that it's close to the more commonly used 7/16ths. Accuracy is superb: once adjusted to zero, the tool returns to it exactly every time. My only quibble is that the second scale on the tool is marked in tenths of an inch. For me, a woodworker, a metric scale would be a handy reference instead.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A Seebart

customer_reviews.title: The fractions are nifty
customer_reviews.text: No problems, good quality caliper. As stated in the description, it only goes down to hundredths of an inch and not thousandths. The trade off to that is that it also has fractions down to 1/64th of an inch. If you need thousandths, look elsewhere. But if you need hundredths and fractions this is perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: FrankenStang

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I have had the cheap plastic ones (1 star) cheap metal from a discount tool place (2-3 stars) and Starrett (5 stars) this was $30 and is not bad. Much nicer than the cheap ones, but not as smooth as the $100 Starrett. But it is accurate and works pretty good for the price. Update: I have had this almost a year (I use it in the woodshop for accurate measurements) and am happy with it. I still think a Starrett is much better, but for the price and the use I am very happy and would buy it again, but it still feels like new so I probably won't need to for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Simple is Best
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of digital calipers to use in woodworking over the years, but the batteries wore out quickly, and the calipers were typically nonfunctional when I needed them the most. I find the dial caliper easy to use, accurate, and always ready to go. I'm pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Supt

customer_reviews.title: Great calipers
customer_reviews.text: Just as easy to read as a ruler. Much better than trying to read digital calipers. I use for measuring my woodworking projects, metal projects, ect.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this isn't a high dollar tool, but for the price I think it is a great value, its not as smooth, rolling action but very repeatable measurements so far. I think as time/use it may get smoother action, I like it for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: David Schuster

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang For the Buck Woodworking Calipers
customer_reviews.text: I use these calipers every day in a Planer Mill for my job. I find them to be well built, well designed and very accurate. The best part is that the dial is set up for reading fractional measurements. You can use the marking to read decimal, but the only reason I would read a decimal is to determine the fraction. The dial very clearly and accurately reads to 1/64 inch, which is exactly the type of measurements I need for manufacturing lumber products. As of the writing of the review, it will be the best $29 you'll spend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reece

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an identical one that I misplaced. I have other calipers, but I like this one with the fractional scale. I think it is a very nice quality tool. Sure enough, a couple of weeks after I got this one, I found the first one!
customer_reviews.author: T. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the money. This is my second purchase for one of these calipers, I lost or misplaced the first on in a recent move. I like the dial much better than the digital units because they never need batteries. Unlike many of the competitors, this unit is all stainless steel, no plastic. It comes in a preformed plastic case that is not very fancy but offers protection and does the job. If I lose this one I would still buy another one...
customer_reviews.author: LowJack

customer_reviews.title: The quality is excellent! The dial is very clear and easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: I've done lots of work in my shop both during my career and afterwards. Many years of building furniture and quite a few metalworking projects. I can't believe I am just now finding this tool. The quality is excellent! The dial is very clear and easy to read. I must admit that it took me a few days to get used to it, but now I grab it constantly. Shop Fox has done me a huge favor. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: W. Holt

customer_reviews.title: Right size, well made and with a case
customer_reviews.text: A very well made unit for the price. I needed a caliper to measure the thickness of rough lumber for planing machines using tenths of inches. While the digital readouts are nice it is easy to use this unit and it needs no batteries to get a accurate reading. Very pleased with purchase and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Fine measurements
customer_reviews.text: This hits the point I was aiming for...more accurate than my normal visual measurements, inexpensive enough that if it gets damaged I won't get emotional (yes, men do get emotional over things like tools) and well constructed enough to survive my shop environment. Anyone that needs to be accurate to thousandths will be out of luck as it will get you close but not to the accuracy that most machinists would require. But, for my wood shop and the occasional out of shop measuring needs, it's close to perfect.
customer_reviews.author: B Gates

customer_reviews.title: been using this for a little better than a year
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a little better than a year. it holds zero well. I rarely have to adjust it and when I do it's a minuscule adjustment. I've had several pair of electronic calipers and they never held calibration for more than a few seconds. So I went old school and I'll never go back.
customer_reviews.author: badbitbucket

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Caliper for Woodworkers
customer_reviews.text: A great value for the money. It's well made, easy to calibrate and accurate for woodworking purposes.
customer_reviews.author: One Pony Show

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a few months now. Smooth, accurate, reads in fractions and never need to change batteries as it has none.
customer_reviews.author: BuzzMorris

customer_reviews.title: Decimal and fractions on the same dial!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool for the money. So far, the construction seems really tight and sturdy. I bought it because it has both decimal and fraction markings on the dial. I already had a metric caliper but was tired of converting millimeters to decimal inches and then figuring out what the closest fractional inch was.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: which are both perfect; it has just the right amount of heft ...
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed was the weight and feel, which are both perfect; it has just the right amount of heft and even with the screw completely disengaged, the feel is rock-solid with absolutely no slop. the action is smooth and perfect every time and the accuracy is spot on and consistent. my Wixey digital caliper has been put back in its case and the Shop Fox has been put in its place for daily use. I'll still use the digital now and then, but I'm very happy to make this analog my go-to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Generall good quality.
customer_reviews.text: A little loose on the slide. Accuracy not quite what I like. Close, but ....
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L Klick

customer_reviews.title: I have been looking for something like this for a while
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for something like this for a while. It is perfect for woodworking because it displays fractions instead of 100ths of an inch. It is well built and accurate, and it costs less than the Starrett model, which is also made in China and looks like it may be made in the same factory.
customer_reviews.author: Str8oz

customer_reviews.title: Looks & feels really well made.  Perfect for me since I don't want the 1000'ths of an inch calipers.
customer_reviews.text: Solid. Looks & feels well made. I like the graduations on the dial since it gives fractional inches plus decimal (1000'ths of an inch). I only want the fractions for my projects around the house and woodworking. Would buy again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in TX

customer_reviews.title: You need one in your shop.
customer_reviews.text: Very good, easy to read, accurate, well made. I build furniture. This tool makes my job easier. No batteries needed.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Paul

customer_reviews.title: A woodworkers perfect caliper
customer_reviews.text: It is the ideal caliper for a wood worker. Another poster said it's a no brainer and they were right. It's a good caliper at a fair price. Woodworkers will appreciate it's 1/64th scale. I like the digital calipers but 1. they need batteries 2. they go to 1/128th. Not to good for woodworking on common equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Noe

customer_reviews.title: Great product and value!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic for woodworking - It works as described. It provides the precision I need and I enjoy that it's marked in fractions. If you're looking for a reasonably priced dial caliper for woodworking, this is your ticket.
customer_reviews.author: Matt L.Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made and far cheaper than the brands usually used by machinists. Very accurate checked against feeler gauges.
customer_reviews.author: R. C. Dickey

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a woodworking shop.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pair of calipers for my workshop and bought these based on reviews. The quality is decent and accuracy appropriate for woodworking. They have a fractional and decimal format. They have been very handy and I recommend them for woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: Piddler

customer_reviews.title: Great accuracy!
customer_reviews.text: Nice caliper, nice hard-shell case. I like the analog caliper, as opposed to a digital.
customer_reviews.author: DaisyMae

customer_reviews.title: I like it and prefer it!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for me. I'd rather have a dial reading because there are NO BATTERIES. In the future Apocalypse, this will work, as well as my hand plane and hand saw. Of course, with a hand saw, I probably won't be needing a dial caliper!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Good caliper for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Really good for the price and it will for sure out last me. I went hog-wild with the electronic stuffs and now am returning back to the good old reliable "analog" stick and dials. They all work when you need them without hunting for the silly batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis T.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and accurate. Could not do woodworking with it. Need to check the depth if your dado, a finger comes out of the bottom measuring the depth. Marked clearly for old eyes (in inches).
customer_reviews.author: Curious John

customer_reviews.title: Happy and the Price is right!
customer_reviews.text: This caliper is made nicely in stainless steel and the dial gauge fractions are very easy to read and accurate. I prefer this to a digital readout since I see the actual fraction rather than the decimal equivalent. Great for woodworking to measure board thickness!
customer_reviews.author: Michael G

customer_reviews.title: Includes mm
customer_reviews.text: Great set with metric, even if not shown on picture
customer_reviews.author: MouseR

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and repeatable with no batteries required.
customer_reviews.text: I always got frustrated that my nice digital calipers had a dead battery. These are purely mechanical and work well. I can easily read the measurement to the 64th on the dial.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Mueller

customer_reviews.title: so this was a wonderful back up to that
customer_reviews.text: The batteries in my digital caliper are always kicking the bucket, so this was a wonderful back up to that. Easy to read for someone who has no machinist background.
customer_reviews.author: RatherDashing

customer_reviews.title: Has paid for itself within the first two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set, easy to read, the Shop Fox Dial Caliper has paid for itself within the first two weeks of receiving it. You pay a little more for it than you would for the cheaper options but you can time when you pick it up and work with it that you have purchased a quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: thunderpaw

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this unit
customer_reviews.text: For woodworking, I recommend this unit. I appreciate not having to calculate and convert from thousandths to inches and fractions as I get older. The tool is well made, not flimsy, and my unit tested out to be very accurate. This was a great purchase value for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have a digital caliper, but sometimes I just can't convert to fractions quick enough. This works great, is quick and easy to read, and I have had none of the problems some of the reviewers have had. I do woodworking nearly every day and I use this nearly every day.
customer_reviews.author: Arookaru

customer_reviews.title: Woodworkers delight
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a dial caliper for woodworkers. The fractional dial readings are just what I needed. Don't know how I missed this one before.
customer_reviews.author: Maine Alan

customer_reviews.title: Great Caliper
customer_reviews.text: I work in an architectural woodworking shop where we have to be precise with our measurements. So far, I have been very impressed with this caliper. Good product for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: New Frontier Pioneer

customer_reviews.title: Well made tool
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I get accurate measurements in a math system that is used by everything in my shop. Getting old and can't read those tiny marks on your drill bits? Grab this and go.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B

customer_reviews.title: I really love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I really love this thing...beats the heck out of using a tape measure. I make lamps and electric guitars and precision is really important. It's really well made and accurate as all get out. I'm VERY glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Martin

customer_reviews.title: This works awesome! Thank you
customer_reviews.text: This is EXACTLY what I was looking for for my marble machine projects. No worries about batteries! This works awesome! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Theodore Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Shop Fox Dial Caliper
customer_reviews.text: Very nice dial caliper. Good fit and finish. Fractional dial is excellent and easy to read. Great deal for the price. Easy to zero out the dial.
customer_reviews.author: M. Buettner

customer_reviews.title: Solid product. Mechanically sound, Accurate, and extremely ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid product. Mechanically sound, Accurate, and extremely inexpensive. Bought a second one as a gift. Would not hesitate to buy again,
customer_reviews.author: Bob G

customer_reviews.title: Should've had this a while ago
customer_reviews.text: This is a great caliper. Just what I've been looking for for a while now. Nice quality, very accurate (for being analog) and nice case. No batteries dying either!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Affordable
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what I was looking for. Easy to read fractions without being high price. I need to use these constantly to measure woodworking parts as part of cabinetmaking.
customer_reviews.author: Colin D

customer_reviews.title: Glad it bought it
customer_reviews.text: very handy if your work in fractions and being a dial there is no battery to die. Glad it bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great Caliper
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Better than my digital one because everytime I go to use the digital one, it needs batteries.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Had it for a week. Holding up so far. No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a week. Holding up so far. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: MarkyMark

customer_reviews.title: If I lost these, I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.text: Like these. They work well and have great accuracy for woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little caliper
customer_reviews.text: This is the first caliper I have ever owned and to be honest I am an idiot for not getting one sooner. Perfect for getting those exact measurements, inside and out. I chose this one because of the fractional readings on the dial and am very happy I did. Seeing the fractions instead of decimal just makes it easier for me, but that's just me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great for wood working
customer_reviews.text: I love this, I use it more than my digital caliper
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly as described and works great.
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking at these for a long time. It is exactly as described and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Barry D

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap calipers.
customer_reviews.text: Good set, slides nice and easy. Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jsb

customer_reviews.title: for the prices these calipers work great. I have used them pretty often for about ...
customer_reviews.text: for the prices these calipers work great. I have used them pretty often for about 4 months and I have no complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product well built and just what I expected it to be. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for when I want to know the nearest fractional ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality Tool. Great for when I want to know the nearest fractional size. Would have been 5 stars but the storage box arrived with a broken hinge.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have used some very fancy calipers and some complete pieces of junk. This one was way cheaper and surprisingly good value.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Tool
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this Caliper for about 3 weeks now. It does a fairly good job. The consturction is lightweight and the thumb knob isn't as precise as something from Starrett, but the price is right. It is accurate and repeatable. I am satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Chips &

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a quality tool. Nice storage box. Price is competetive. Don't like battery operated, digital calipers. Would recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mcleod

customer_reviews.title: Good for "old Eyes"
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read with "old eyes". Very accurate for segment wood turning projects.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Mccorkle

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: very nice; I prefer the dial indicator and it work as expected; delivery was appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: Has nice feel to it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing zeros in every time. I'm really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus in AZ

customer_reviews.title: a work of art
customer_reviews.text: I have searched forever trying to find a quality dial caliper with fractional markings. This caliper far exceeded my expectations. It even shows the intermediate fractions, i.e., 3/16", 5/16", etc. If you would have handed it to me and asked me how much I thought it cost, I would would have guessed $90. I'm so impressed with the quality, I plan to buy a second one to have on hand as an extra.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I like the dual dial. Easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dial Caliper
customer_reviews.text: Had to wait a while for this tool (back ordered) but it was worth the wait. Very well made and I like the fraction dial much better then the digital kind at least for me. Very smooth to operate and I enjoy using.Did a lot of research before buying and I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie h

customer_reviews.title: looks v. good; v. accurate; works v. good. over all v.v.v. good!
customer_reviews.text: very well made. hardened stainless., engraved numbers / divisions, smooth operation. no slop. verified accuracy using starrett standard calib. rods, a 2" & 3". wiped jaw contact surfaces, zeroed dial at closed posit. indications at 2 & 3 ins., exact! also case has an actual full length steel pined hinge, dense foam padded, good plastic, positive latch. looks good to me.
customer_reviews.author: bobfmbutte

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The caliper is good, but the plastic protector case was broken in half when shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My woodworking has improved i can now dial in perfect tight joints on my tablesaw and mitersaw.
customer_reviews.author: Max C.

customer_reviews.title: A pleasure to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great - feels solid - a pleasure to use
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: I use it everyday and it is easy to adjust and easy to read the bar scale and the dial
customer_reviews.author: alan amenta

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Its a reasonable caliper. Its good to hundredths of an inch for metalwork and 1/64ths for woodworking. My only issue is the needle on mine was bent about the width of the needle blade itself between the fractional and decimal scales .. which means I have to rezero it for changing scales. If actual thousandths was wanted, the company should swap the locations of the fractional and decimal scales (which would be a reasonable thing to do regardless, considering the decimal scale has greater accuracy than the fractional 1/64ths). Swapping the scale locations would give the caliper accuracy to .001 instead of a mere .01(5). Still, not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gaetz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I'm a woodworker and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth S.

customer_reviews.title: Great item!!!`
customer_reviews.text: Works how it says. I measured some spacers I know are 1/4, 1/2, 3/4 and this caliper measures them spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Hanohano

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for me.
customer_reviews.text: The accuracy is just fine for the work that I do and converting to millimeters is simple math. Easy and inexpensive to use since I don't have to put in an expensive battery.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Grimm

customer_reviews.title: Good caliper!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice caliper, operates smoothly, shipped well and fast. graduations are easy to read and the fractional indicator is a huge bonus for woodworking. Much better than using the digitals since 128ths are massive overkill!
customer_reviews.author: Brent H

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price. Pay attention to the description, this measures .01", not .001".
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Pay attention to the description, this measures .01", not .001". But I have micrometers for anything less than that.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: It's a very good tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good tool for the price. Easy to use and accurate, it serves my needs very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: no metric scale
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize there was no metric measurement. otherwise a good quality caliper
customer_reviews.author: David Lippie

customer_reviews.title: No useful metric at
customer_reviews.text: Extra care about imperials only. No useful metric at all
customer_reviews.author: LE GALL

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good quality product if it fits your needs
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the wrong product. Didn't read the title. Seems like a good quality product if it fits your needs.
customer_reviews.author: sg4082

customer_reviews.title: The fractional measurements are on the outer dial!
customer_reviews.text: This is a top notch dial caliper for the money. It is very accurate and easily adjustable both for setting dial to zero and when measuring to lock measurement in to read it. With the increments to the outer part of the dial it increases the distance between them making reading the needle easiest. I put a bit of light oil on the rack and pinion, ran it a few times, blew it out and wiped it down. It was already working well but I wanted the smoothest possible action. There are cheaper calipers out there but the Shop Fox has them beat!
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

product_meta.title: Shop Fox D3208 Fractional Dial Caliper
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This 6-Inch stainless steel Fractional Dial Caliper combines metalworking precision with a fractional scale for woodworkers. Perfect for measuring board thickness, depth and inside dimensions. Dial reads 64th and 0.01-Inch.
feature_bullets: 4-way measurements: inside, outside, depth, and step
Micro fine black dial is graduated in 0.01 Inch
